channel.title: [REQ] Class8 to itemDef int converter?
channel.description:
Been searching on Google if anything like this exists but couldn't find it. Does anyone know where to find such thing or know a good tutorial to do that?
Thanks!

item.title: [REQ] Class8 to itemDef int converter?
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

just copy one of the sword ints in itemdef.java
and change it so it matches the class8.java version
something like this

case 20061: itemDef.modelid = 10247; itemDef.name = "Abyssal vine whip"; itemDef.description = "Abyssal vine whip"; itemDef.modelZoom = 848; itemDef.modelRotationY = 324; itemDef.modelRotationX = 1808; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 5; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 38; itemDef.anInt165 = 10253; itemDef.anInt200 = 10253; itemDef.groundActions = new String[5]; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.itemActions[2] = "Split"; itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop"; break;
to

case 20061: itemDef.modelid = 10247; itemDef.name = "Armadyl Staff"; itemDef.description = "A staff used by the best Armadyl warriors."; itemDef.modelZoom = 848; itemDef.modelRotationY = 324; itemDef.modelRotationX = 1808; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 5; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 38; itemDef.anInt165 = 13297; itemDef.anInt200 = 13297; itemDef.groundActions = new String[5]; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.itemActions[2] = "Split"; itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop"; break;
this is not done yet, but do it like this.

Read full topic

item.title: [REQ] Class8 to itemDef int converter?
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“smous, post:5, topic:541345”]I got till that yes but what I meant was if I add this Int
[spoiler]if(i == #####)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wield”;
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 0;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 0;
class8.anInt174 = 13298;
class8.anInt181 = 1490;
class8.anInt190 = 148;
class8.anInt198 = 1400;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = -5;
class8.anInt194 = 2;
class8.anInt165 = 13297;
class8.anInt200 = 13297;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
Cass8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.aString170 = “Armadyl Staff”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “A staff used by the best Armadyl warriors.”.getBytes();
}[/spoiler]
to my itemDef file and compile it comes up with errors, that’s a no brainer. So I was wondering; what do I have to change to make it work?[/quote]

What is the error?
